fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira Cloud backup manager limits how often backups can be created.

In Server a Jira Administrator can reset this timer, but in Cloud this is a restricted function

This can be limiting during migration projects where a Cloud site needs to be backed up multiple times in a short period during a weekend migration, or prior to an import etc.

See this knowledge base article for further information: [JIRA: Backup frequency is limited. You can not make another backup right now|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-backup-frequency-is-limited-you-can-not-make-another-backup-right-now-779160825.html]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From the Backup Manager screen create a Backup for Cloud (ticking the box to include attachments, avatars and logos)
 # Click the button to create another backup

h3. Expected Results

A second backup would be able to be generated
h3. Actual Results

The below error message is shown
{noformat}
Export error
* Backup frequency is limited. You cannot make another backup right now. Approximate time until next allowed backup: 47h 59m
Please try again later or contact support if error persists.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

You can uncheck the box to include Attachments, Ava**tars & Logos and you will be able to kick off a new backup
fields.summary: Allow Site Backups to be Taken More Frequently than every 48hrs

fields.description:
On macOS there is a Jira client available on the AppStore.

This look like a great product to use with native notification support and everything, however, there is a UX issue regarding the comment form.

Indeed, unlike the web version, when we hit enter in the comment form, it send the message by default instead of doing a line break.

Current behavior isn't explicit:
 * there is no user settings for that
 * there is no label explaining what action do what (enter to send, alt enter for a line break)
 * there is a send button visible, which isn't the common UX for forms that validate with enter

You should add a label to avoid confusion, and let this behavior to the end user choice.

When we use the Jira Desktop client to use with Jira Service Desk, message will be sent to company's customers, we need to be able to do proper text formating in that situation.
fields.summary: Jira Desktop on macOS shouldn't send message when we hit enter by default

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 Notifications are one of the fundamentals of using a Software system. While Jira Cloud has so many functions, it would be good if an API method can be available to control the notification scheme in terms of:
# Adding / Removing Events from the Schema
# Setting Notification events based on Workflow triggers.

Anyway, that would enable developers to be able to customize how the notification could be sent out. 

h3. Why is it Important
In an organization that relies heavily on notifications,  to be able to dynamically change the notification scheme will help reduce the noise of notification to certain individuals within the organization.
fields.summary: Ability to Allow Notification Scheme to be configurable via API

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
* Currently, Jira mobile and the Jira Cloud app for Mac does not have the feature to view Issue history via the app.

h4. Suggested Solution
* To have the option to view the Issue history directly from the app.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update - 16 Nov 2021}
Hi everyone,

I am excited to let you know that we now support issue history on Android, iOS, iPadOS and MacOS. To check it out please make sure you are running the latest version of our app! 

If you have any feedback for us please let us know!

Best regards,
Jack Curtis
Product Manager - Jira Native Apps
{panel}
fields.summary: Ability to view issue history via Jira mobile and Jira Cloud app for Mac

fields.description: I like jira, but why they insist that when I create an issue I don't want to actually see the created issue is beyond me! Having to scroll about a mile off my main eye focus to catch the "popup" hinting I created it and have to click a link is just bad UX.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the 'Create' issue prompt to take me to the issue after creation

fields.description: The ability to switch between Detail View and List View in the Issue Navigator is useful. However in the Detail View, the only information that the user sees in the list of results is the Issue Type, Issue Key, and Summary. This is sometimes not sufficient for the user to pick which issue they want to see as there could be multiple issues of the same type and similar summary. Often a user knows which issue they need and that can be identified by the status that it is in. Therefore I would suggest that the status is displayed in the white space next to the issue key.
fields.summary: Show Status in Issue Navigator Detail View Results Pane

fields.description:
In AgileCraft (aka Jira Align), when viewing a page (ex: Team room), there is a list of assigned Team Members as little circle icons on the right side of the screen, above the work list/queue.

If you hover the mouse over any Team Member icon, then a hover-over box is shown.

The Team Member name is blue, against a dark blue background. It's very difficult to read from many angles.

 

Enhancement: restyle the Hover Over so that the information is more easily visible.
fields.summary: [JIRA ALIGN] Team Member hover over shows blue name on dark blue background - hard to read

fields.description:
h4. Problem definition
* The 2 missing parts in the integration are the ability to link Jira tickets
to deals and company in Hubspot and there is no option to filter or create a report for the
Jira-Hubspot tickets, either in Jira and in Hubspot. 

h4. Suggested solution
* To add the data of the Jira ticket in a new HubSpot property it could
be used to filter and create reports in Hubspot & Jira
* An option to filter all the linked CRM ticket within Jira
fields.summary: Report option for Jira Cloud for CRM add-on

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

The roles listed in the "Add people" dropdown should be ordered in a way that the *system/jira provided roles are listed first in alphabetical order, followed by user-created roles listed also in alphabetical order.*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a project > Project Settings > People
 # Click on "Add people" > Click on the "Roles" dropdown

h3. Expected Results

The roles should be listed as:

*system/jira provided roles are listed first in alphabetical order, followed by user-created roles in alphabetical order.*
h3. Actual Results

There is no order to the roles, looks to be random:  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Project roles on the "Add people" dropdown is not correctly ordered

fields.description:
When a is comment hovered over, the comment should be highlighted. This is available in the old issue view.

The highlight aids readability.
fields.summary: New issue view Comment hover highlight

fields.description:
On the Old Issue View, Jira displays the Issue Type icon and the Issue Type name beside the Issue Key.

On the New Issue View, Jira displays only the icon for the Issue Type which can make it difficult to identify if which Issue Type the issue was created.
h3. Suggestion

Add the Issue type name on the New Issue View instead of rover the mouse over the icon.
h3. Workaround

+*Workaround 1*+

Currently, you can hover over the icon of the issue type, which will show a text with the issue type's name:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-19 at 10.22.50.png|thumbnail!

+*Workaround 2*+

It's possible to create a text custom field and fill this through an Automation rule whenever a new issue is created. The rule structure would be the following:

!image-2021-06-01-19-49-51-826.png|width=507,height=164!

It's a good approach is to create single-project rules to avoid using monthly rule execution limit. Automation rules execution is unlimited for single-project scope rules.
fields.summary: Display the Issue Type name on New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is pretty simple to delete a project in Jira. That straight forward process might not be the ideal scenario for such an invasive procedure. When a project is deleted, there is no option to restore it natively. When the restore is necessary the user must contact the support team and it has a cost and demand time for the support team. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
To make it easier to restore a deleted project we should have a *trash*/*achieve* feature that stores the "deleted" project for like 2 weeks until it runs a job to delete the project completely. This should give the team time to revisit the project if needed and mitigate the need for the restore when that deletion is "accidental".
fields.summary: Create an archive/trash to store deleted projects

fields.description: In most use cases, there's no point in creating branches for Done issues in Jira. It would be useful to have a functionality to "Hide" this option when the issue is in a determined status.
fields.summary: Disable "create branch" option depending on issue status

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding an issue key from the new issue view editor does not create a link to the issue. The issue key is rendered as a link for a second and then it becomes text only.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a comment to any issue using the new issue view with an issue key on it
# Refresh the page and observe the behavior

Here's a video of it:
 [^IssueHyperlinkBug.mp4] 
Also, my colleague was able to reproduce it but there's a different behavior, but it still a bug. Here's his video:
 [^Bug test.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
The issue key is rendered as a link

h3. Actual Results
The issue key is rendered as text only.

h3. Notes
Switching back to the old issue view shows it correctly.

h3. Workaround
Disable the new issue view
fields.summary: Issue keys are not rendered as links in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Ability to export projects with details(created, category, permission scheme, last viewed, last used)

h3. Expected Results

Customers should be able to export projects with details(created, category, permission scheme, last viewed, last used)

h3. Actual Results

Customers are not able to export projects with details(created, category, permission scheme, last viewed, last used)
fields.summary: Ability to export projects with details(created, category, permission scheme, last viewed, last used)
Broken attachments due to a large number of files in the issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can setup a wallboard slideshow so gadgets from more than one dashboard will be presented in the screen.

Currently, it seems like the previous checked dashboard is the only one to be displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Mark two dashboards as favourite;
* Click on *Set up wallboard slideshow* -> check both the dashboards -> *Done*:
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-06 at 11.29.56.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-12-06 at 11.30.04.png|thumbnail! 
* Click on *View wallboard slideshow*:
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-06 at 11.31.46.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Gadgets from both dashboards will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

The presentation may end up displaying gadgets from only one dashboard.

See the recording:  [^Wallboard Slideshow.mp4] 

In some cases, it is possible that only one column of the presentation will get stuck with displaying gadgets from only one of the dashboards.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Wallboard slideshow displays gadgets from only one dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Approvals history items with deleted status' are breaking the Bento view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an approval status on your workflow.
# Transition the ticket and approve it.
# Now, delete the status created on the first step.

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to access the ticket in the new issue view.

h3. Actual Results

The ticket does not load as the ticket history points to the deleted status and the below exception is thrown in the logs.
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.approvals.internal.approval.ApprovalResponseConvertor.classicGetApprovalStatusDTO(ApprovalResponseConvertor.java:131)
    at com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.approvals.internal.approval.ApprovalResponseConvertor.getStatus(ApprovalResponseConvertor.java:112)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Access the ticket via the new issue view or clone the ticket.
fields.summary: Approvals history items with deleted status' are breaking on new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Formatted "markdown" text doesn't work on the new WYSIWYG editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a template using the markdown syntax
 # Paste on a comment or description using the new issue view

h3. Expected Results

The text will show correctly.
h3. Actual Results

It won't be correctly formatted and it will be necessary to manually format everything.

!Screen Recording 2019-12-06 at 10.38 AM.gif!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Formatted "markdown" text doesn't work on the new WYSIWYG editor

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Although customers can export the list of all users on the instance which include the group, name, email, active, etc using the *Export users* feature via *USER MANAGEMENT* page. The list does not include the projects related to each user.

h3. Proposed Solution 
Include a new field that defines the projects in which the user is involved in.
fields.summary: Export users list should include projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per summary, the JQL query for slack integration is returning error when ampersand is used as field value. The same JQL query when used in the issue navigator does not cause any errors.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a single select list custom field. 
 # Put in a value with an ampersand in the field list i.e "Test 4 & Test 5".
 # Create a Slack integration with a sample JIRA project.
 # Attempt to add a JQL condition into the Slack integration. Make sure to specify the custom field in step 1 and reference the field value in step 2.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

When used as a JQL condition in Slack integration, it should not return problems.

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

JQL query cannot be used due to error.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Slack integration JQL query do not support usage of ampersand (&)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When opening a zip file in new issue view, it will preview the file in new issue view rather than downloading them from the ticket, 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload a zip file to the ticket
# Click on the zip file to download file from the ticket
# The file open in preview mode.

h3. Expected Results

The file should be downloaded rather than opening in preview mode.

h3. Actual Results

"We can't preview this file type.
Try downloading the file to view it."

The file can not preview as this is not a media file.

h3. Workaround

Switch back to the old UI from the *Personal Settings* by doing the following: 
# Click on your avatar picture (bottom left corner of the screen) and select "Personal Settings", or just navigate to: https://XXXXXX.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
# In the "Jira Labs" section, click to disable the New Jira issue view
fields.summary: Clicking on the zip file in new issue view open the preview mode instead of download

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the user is imported (CSV, Migration or API) with a comma in the username, it will break the ticket history that contains any user picker field, such as reporter and assignee.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user importing from CSV with a comma in the username;
# Create a ticket and assign to this user;
# Check the ticket history.

h3. Expected Results

Jira will render the user normally and show it in the ticket history.

h3. Actual Results

Jira shows a broken history.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Broken ticket history when the user has a comma in the username

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the user is imported (CSV, Migration or API) with a comma in the username, it will break the notifications that contain any user picker field, such as reporter and assignee.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user importing from CSV with a comma in the username;
# Create a ticket and assign to this user; 
# Check the notification.

h3. Expected Results

Jira will render the user normally and show it in the notification.

h3. Actual Results

Jira sends a broken notification.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Broken notifications when the user has a comma in the username

fields.description:
We have Jira in the cloud with Jira service desk. 

 

Occasionally we receive emails to a group email address.  Then someone from the team files this email to Jira via an outlook plugin.   Upon the email filing a case is created within the appropriate service desk. 

But how can we make sure that all other users i.e. the group who received the email is aware that the email has already been filed to Jira ?  Otherwise we risk two or more people will file the same email and then multiply identical cases will be created. 

 

Thanks

Birkir
fields.summary: Two users with Jira Outlook plugin

fields.description:
h2. Problem

Currently, there are few fields to search for issues on Jira mobile:
 * Project
 * Type
 * Status
 * Assignee
 * Resolution
 * Label
 * Fix Version
 * Affects Version
 * Order by

With that said, we can't create new filters or use the advanced search in order to find the issues we need based on other fields.
h2. Resolution

Add an option to create filters or use advanced search or add the option to use all fields on the basic search.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update - 16 Nov 2021}
Hi everyone,

Excited to let you know we have started work on editing & adding new filters on iOS, iPad OS and MacOS. This will be shipped in Q2 FY22 and we plan to start development on Android soon after. I will share another update here once we have shipped!

In the meantime, if you have other feedback please add a comment here or you can email ([mailto:jack@atlassian.com]) me directly!

Best regards,
Jack Curtis
Product Manager - Jira Native Apps
{panel}
fields.summary: Ability to create and edit filter on Jira mobile

fields.description: Please allow for this feature to be added
fields.summary: I want to build customizble reports or add additional columns to my sprint report

fields.description: Today, the @mention notification adds a link to the issue the user was mentioned, not to the specific comment where the mention occurred. It would avoid a big effort to scroll through an issue with several comments if the link pointed to the specific comment the user was mentioned.
fields.summary: In a @mention notification, add a link to the specific comment the user was mentioned instead of the issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When pasting single digit decimal numbers into the new issue view, the 1st digit is replaced with a numbered list.
h4. Example
{quote}1.5 -> 1. 5

3.6 -> 1. 6

5.7 -> 1. 7
{quote}
Clicking off the *Numbered List* button in the editor does _not_ correct the issue. It will simply remove the numbered list and leave only the digits after the decimal. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  Type a single-digit decimal somewhere outside of Jira (i.e. 4.5, 2.7, 3.6, etc) Copy it to your clipboard.
 # Open an issue in the new issue view.
 # Paste the number into the new issue view.

h3. Expected Results

Numbers should be pasted without formatting into a numbered list.
h3. Actual Results

The numbers will automatically be converted into a numbered list.
h4. Original:

!CleanShot 2019-12-04 at 13.56.18.png!
h4. New Issue View:

!CleanShot 2019-12-04 at 13.56.51.png|width=350,height=149!
h3. Workaround

Pasting directly into a code snippet does retain the original values.  In addition, copying from a raw text editor also appears to work.
 * Pasting without formatting (e.g. CMD+SHIFT+OPTION+V on macOS) does _not_ work to avoid the formatting.
 * Clicking off on Numbered List only will remove the numbered list, but will not correct the issue (i.e. 5.7 which has been changed to 1. 7 will only revert back to 7)
 * Adding the content to a text editor and copying from there avoids the auto-formatting

h3. Notes

Many users may report this as an issue with copying and pasting tables from Excel, or tables from pages in Confluence that are using the Old Editor.

I can confirm that the issue persists without pasting from a table or list. You could paste a single number and it will still auto-convert.

This issue also exists in the Confluence new editor.
fields.summary: Pasting single digit decimal numbers in new issue  results in numbered list replacing the first digit

fields.description:
When we work with stories, we need to create tasks for that story, but we don't want them as sub-tasks (which is easy to create), we need them as Tasks/Bugs.

Right now, we need to first create the new Task, then link it to the story. this is a hassle.

 

we would like to have 'Create and Link' button. this will make our process much more streamlined
fields.summary: as a user, i would like to have the option to create and link an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In New Issue View "Edit Own Worklog" permission is working only when the user has "Edit All Worklog" and "Work On Issue" permission

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove "Edit All Worklog" permission 
 # Provide "Edit Own Worklog" permission to the user.
 Go back to the ticket.
 User will not be able to "Edit own Worklog"

h3. Expected Results
 # Having "Edit Own Worklog", the user should be able to edit own worklog in New Issue View.

h3. Actual Results
# Having "Edit Own Worklog", the user cannot edit own worklog in New Issue View.

h3. Workaround
Use Old Issue View.
fields.summary: In New Issue View "Edit Own Worklog"permission is working only when the user has "Edit All Worklog" and "Work On Issue" permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing an issue in a next-gen project, it's possible to log work (from the top right meatball menu) against that issue even if the issue type does not have an associated time tracking field.

This leads to confusing experiences for customers where work can be logged against an . issue but they cannot search for tickets based on worklogDate unless the time tracking field is retroactively added to the issue type.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a next-gen project (JSW or JSD). 
# Go to project settings > issue types/request types
# Find an issue/request type without the time tracking field
# Create an issue of this type
# Click the meatball menu top right and log work

h3. Expected Results
You cannot log work without the time tracking field

h3. Actual Results
You can log work without the time tracking field. You can see this in the Worklog feed.

h3. Workaround
None.
If you are encountering problems searching for issues in JQL using the worklogDate, you can add the time tracking field to the issue type and the issues will then appear in JQL.
fields.summary: Logging work on an issue is possible in next-gen projects when the time tracking field is not associated with the issue type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Renamed users cannot be searched using their email in the project's People section

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change a user's username
# Search for the user using their email in project's People section

h3. Expected Results
The user is retrieved
h3. Actual Results
The user is not retrieved

h3. Workaround
Search using the display name instead
fields.summary: Renamed user cannot be searched using email in People

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Glance panel column renders with narrow width after resizing window

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Open issue in full page view
2. Open a glance panel
3. Resize window so that Bento collapses into single column view
4. Resize window back to the previous width

h3. Expected Results
The glance panel will still be rendered at the same width as before

h3. Actual Results
The glance panel is now more narrow than before, and there is extra whitespace between the content view and the glance panel.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Glance panel column renders with narrow width after resizing window

fields.description: This is not supported at the moment for paid accounts, only for GitHub Enterprise.
fields.summary: Provide support for Smart Links associated with GitHub paid accounts

fields.description:
h2. Problem


Currently, if a user configured fields on a particular issue type (Task, Bug, Story, Epic), the next time that user opens that same issue type those same fields stay configured as "Custom". For example, If a Task issue was created with configured fields, the next time a Task issue is created it would have those same fields still displayed. Same thing for a Bug, Story, Epic and so on. Note: What you configure in a Task wont be configured in a Bug.

Each project the user has access to has their own set of issue types. The Task issue configured fields in one project will not carry over to a second project. The second project would save the configured fields for the Task issue type belonging to it. Thus, every time the user opens a Task issue in second project the configured fields remain the same for the Task issues. Just like the first project.
h2. Suggestion


Add an option on User Defaults for the admin to select if users will see Custom or All fields when creating a ticket.
fields.summary: Ability to set the default option as "Custom" or "All" when users create tickets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you remove a user who created a project there is no way to modify the default assignee in next gen. This is only a problem if allow unassigned issues is turned off.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Turn off 'allow unassigned issues' in global configuration
 # Have another user create a next gen project with themselves as the lead
 # Check that inline create works as expected on backlog
 # Remove that user from the site / jira instance
 # Attempt to inline create on backlog or roadmap, this should fail

h3. Expected Results
Inline create works

h3. Actual Results
Inline create fails

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Removing the project lead in a NextGen project when unassigned issues is disabled results in broken inline create on backlog and roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the JSON import, the Story Points Estimate field does not work properly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Next-Gen project;
# Ensure that you have the Estimation setting enabled;
# Try to import a dummy JSON file, like this example:  [^dummy.json] 

h3. Expected Results

The Story Points Estimate will be imported as expected.

h3. Actual Results

The Story Points Estimate field is not imported.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JSON Import does not import Story Points in Next-Gen projects.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When trying to change the default email address for the Project notifications to a different one but you don't have the correct permissions to proceed, the error says that the domain is not claimed:
!image.png|thumbnail!

That might be incorrect and seem to occur when the user is not one of the Org admins where the domain was claimed. 

h3. How to test this behavior:
# Verify your domain, configure the DKIM & SPF records as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-979428371.html].
# Ensure that the domains are correctly claimed [here|https://domain-check.atlassian.com/].
# Try to update a Project's email send while not being one of the Org admins. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
# Enhance the error message so the user knows what need to be done to complete that task such as:
{quote}
It seems that you don't have the necessary permission to proceed with this change. Reach out to one of the Org admins of your site and as him/her to proceed with this change.
{quote}
fields.summary: Enhance the message when trying to change the default notification email address of a Project when the domain is correctly verified.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user does not have any application access but has the site-admins group access, while accessing a project all issues (/projects/projectKey/issues/?filter=allissues), Jira will throw an "Internal Server Error".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* 1. Remove the site-admins group from all the application accesses;
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-02 at 14.50.31.png|thumbnail! 
* 2. Create a user and only grant the site-admins group;
 !Screen Shot 2019-12-02 at 14.51.06.png|thumbnail! 
* 3. Try to access a project all issues filter at /projects/projectKey/issues/?filter=allissues.

h3. Expected Results

Jira shows an error that the user does not have permission to view it.

h3. Actual Results

Jira throws an "Internal Server Error". It can be viewed in the videos below:
- https://share.getcloudapp.com/v1um1ekp
- https://share.getcloudapp.com/X6uDkomR

h3. Workaround

Grant any Jira application access to the user.
fields.summary: Site-admin without any Jira access receives an "Internal Server Error" when accessing all issues filter in a project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the new issue view, you do not have any options to open an attachment file in a new window or tab on your browser.

Right-clicking does not bring up the *Open Link in New Tab* nor does the cmd+click (mac) or ctrl+click (windows) work.

h3. Proposed solution

Allow the option to use the browser's *Open Link in New Tab* for attachments in the new view.
fields.summary: Option to open attachments in a new tab

fields.description:
The users on my team would like the option to view the Jira Cloud UI in "Dark Mode".

Dark Mode is a supplemental mode that can be used to display mostly dark surfaces on the UI. The design reduces the light emitted by device screens while maintaining the minimum color contrast ratios required for readability.

Advantages Include:
 * Enhances visual ergonomics by reducing eye strain, facilitating screens to adjust according to current light conditions and providing comfort of use at night or in dark environments
 * Conserves energy and battery power, thereby enabling device usage for longer periods without charging
fields.summary: Option for "Dark Mode" in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's only available to display Jira issue filter to a Confluence page using the Jira Issue Macro.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to embed Jira issue filter to an external site.
fields.summary: Ability to embed a Jira Issue Filter to an external site

fields.description:
The issue is while creating sub task issue type ..the value for subtask issue type doesn't persists.

Select a sub task from the drop down and then click create the selected sub task doesn't persists.
fields.summary: When creating a subtask on the issue, when opening the pop-up it doesn´t keep the subtask created, leading to errors on the creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the classic issue view, an attachments box containing all the attachments on the issue was present. This allowed users to view all attachments at a quick glance, sort them by a number of sorting options, and also download them. This feature should also be brought to the new issue view.
fields.summary: Bring global attachments panel to new issue view

fields.description:
In compliance with GDPR, we have rolled out visibility control for the user's profile and it's possible for the user to toggle this setting from id.atlassian.com as referred from:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/update-your-profile-and-visibility-settings-976161175.html

But as a site admin who managed the site, he should be able to retrieve email addresses from the REST API since they could export the email address from the user export (user management). It would be beneficial if we have a dedicated API endpoint for the admins to retrieve the email address of the users regardless of the profile visibility that configured from id.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: Ability to retrieve user email address regardless of the profile visibility

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 February 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this ticket and patience as we've prioritised it against other asks. *We are pleased to announce that we have now rolled out an improvement that displays the Epic Status field on the new issue view.*

In order to view the Epic Status field you will need to ensure that the field is added to your screen configuration. You can then move the field around your epics' issue view (including to the left hand side) using the new issue view's layout configuration ([more info|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/configure-field-layout-in-the-issue-view/]). 
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

When configuring the Epic status to show on the issue screens, it will not show of Epics in the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Add Epic Status to the Screen for Epics in a project.
2. Create an Epic
3. View the epic in the new issue view 
4. Go to "Configure" for the Issue Layout
h3. Expected Results

1. The Epic Status field is visible and editable.
2. The Epic Status field can be added or reordered at the Issue Layout
h3. Actual Results

1. The Epic Status field is not visible in the view screen on the new issue view.
2. The Epic Status field does not appear on the issue field layout.
h3. Workaround

Use the old issue view
fields.summary: Adding Epic status to Issue screens does not make it appear on new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a situation, whereby you need to re-use the same project over and over again. Currently it is not possible to reset the issuekey counter on a Project from the UI. The only solution would be  to delete the issues in order to use the project. 

h3. Suggestion
Make a settings on the Project, where after deleting issues, the user can be able to reset the issuekey counter and start the Project afresh.
fields.summary: Ability to reset the issuekey counter of a Project from the UI

fields.description:
*Summary*

When an issue is created with the "Date Time Picker" custom field, the value picked versus the actual value in the ticket does not match. For example:

Issue Create: 11/28/2019
 Ticket View: 11/26/0019

The bug causes the day to backtrack by 2 and the year value is incorrect. The result may vary in terms of how random the outcome is.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a custom field with "Date Time Picker" and attach it with the appropriate screens.
 # Set the following format in the Advanced Settings:

{code:java}
jira.date.picker.javascript.format: MM/dd/yyyy h:mm a 
jira.date.time.picker.java.format: %m/%d/%y %I:%M %p
{code}
*Expected Results*

Date should appear: 09/29/2019 01:46 AM

*Actual Results*

!incorrect_date.PNG|thumbnail!

Instead it appears as: 09/29/0019 01:46 AM

*Workaround:*

Change the format in the Advance Settings to:
{code:java}
jira.date.picker.javascript.format: dd/MMM/yy h:mm a
jira.date.time.picker.java.format: %e/%b/%y %I:%M %p
{code}
fields.summary: Date Time Picker Field Changes Randomly During Issue Creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom Field - "Last commented by a User Flag doesn't work for users whose cwd_user.username do not match app_user.key
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change user key in app_user table to something else than lower_user_name, I think you could do it in the past by renaming user, now you will need to manually update data in db.
 # Add the user to jira-developers group. Create it if necessary.
 # Create field of type Last commented by a User Flag.
 # Create issue as another user who is not part of jira-developers.
 # Comment as the first user on the issue.

h3. Expected Results

Last commented by a User Flag is set to true, as the field doesn't recognise the first user as member of jira-developers.
h3. Actual Results

Last commented by a User Flag is set to false, as the field recognise the first user as member of jira-developers.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom Field - "Last commented by a User Flag doesn't work for users whose cwd_user.username do not match app_user.key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the requirement on the outer condition to match ALL and the requirement on the inner conditions to match ANY, and then the outer condition is deleted, the requirement for the inner conditions will automatically change to match ALL.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create conditions and set requirement to match ALL. Create a grouped condition and set requirement to match ANY.
  !image-2019-11-28-12-54-50-916.png|thumbnail!
 # Delete outer condition (with match ALL statement).
  !image-2019-11-28-12-55-14-704.png|thumbnail!
 # Statement for remaining conditions automatically changes from match ANY to match ALL.
  !image-2019-11-28-12-55-40-527.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Statement for remaining conditions does not change and retain the initial condition of match ANY.

h3. Actual Results
Statement for remaining conditions automatically changes from match ANY to match ALL.

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: When deleting grouped conditions in workflow transitions, the match ALL or match ANY statement for the nested conditions is altered

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Text values that include HTML encoding such as {code}&{code} are translated into the actual character in the old issue view. The new issue view doesn't translate it, which should be the expected behavior.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
1) Enter the following comment on an issue using the new issue view for example:
{code}
test1 & test2
{code}
2) Post the comment
3) Change the view to the old issue view
4) Notice that it will display the comment as & instead of the text entered

h3. Expected Results
Text should remain as the original value entered

h3. Actual Results
Old issue view considers the HTML encode and changes the value in display

h3. Workaround
Use the new issue view
fields.summary: Old issue view translates HTML encoding

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users access the "People" session in the project's administration view, the role drop-down in People session is displayed empty

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a project and in the left menu click *Project settings > People*
# Click the *Roles* select option menu

h3. Expected Results

All the roles are displayed

h3. Actual Results

The roles aren't displayed

 !Screen Shot 2019-11-27 at 8.58.17 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The role drop-down in People session is displayed empty

fields.description:
On a Time Tracking Report, selecting "Incomplete Issues Only" hides all issues without time estimates, this can be misleading for users.

As a Jira user, I want the Time Tracking Report to show unresolved issues when selecting the option "Incomplete Issues Only".
fields.summary: The Time Tracking Report should show unresolved issues when selecting the "Incomplete Issues Only" option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The audit log is recording the internal IP for the project deleted event.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Delete a project.
# Check the audit log.
# The audit log will record the internal IP.

h3. Expected Results
The audit log show displays the user IP.

h3. Actual Results
The audit log shows an internal IP.

h3. Workaround
No workarounds.
fields.summary: The audit log is recording the internal IP for the project deleted event.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Importing attachments via CSV is adding broken attachments links for the new Jira issue view.
 The attachments are being successfully imported and they are rendering as expected for the old Jira issue view, however, for the new Jira issue view, it is showing a thumbnail with the messages "Failed to load" and "Retry".

!Screen Shot 2019-11-26 at 16.58.49.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import attachments via CSV

h3. Expected Results

The imported attachments will be displayed in the new Jira issue view.
h3. Actual Results

The imported attachments are not displayed in the new Jira issue view, they are showing a thumbnail with the messages "Failed to load" and "Retry".
h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: Importing attachments via CSV is adding broken attachments links for the new Jira issue view.

fields.description:
I spend a lot of time in meetings and I would like to automate or make it easier to log time spent on meetings on projects/tasks in Jira.

We have the Jira Cloud Outlook +*_email_*+ plugin but would love something more for the +_*calendar*_+ to log time and/or associate meeting to a jira.

 

*From* the Outlook Calendar = _send to issue with work log_ or something

!image-2019-11-26-13-02-00-394.png!
fields.summary: Log Time to jira / Associate Meetings from Outlook Office 365

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When opening a *Move* operation in an issue, and then navigating to a different browser tab to open the *Move* operation in a different issue, you will not be able to proceed with the process in the first issue due to a timeout:
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-26 at 14.01.56.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Open an issue *A* in one tab;
* Open an issue *B* in a different tab;
* In the issue *A*, click on the *ellipses button* in the top right -> *Move*;
* Do the same in the issue *B*;
* Navigate back to the issue *A* and try to proceed with the process.

See the recording:  [^Session time out.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results

You will be able to proceed with the move process.

h3. Actual Results

You will not be able to proceed with the process due to a session time out error.

h3. Workaround

If you need to move more than one issue, use bulk-operation.
fields.summary: Session time out when opening the move operation in multiple issues in different browser tabs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Comment adding during an issue transition does not show on the Issue details view until the page s refreshed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment screen to a transition
 # Go to an issue and transition it
 # Add a comment and save

h3. Expected Results

The comment will appear after transitioning the issue
h3. Actual Results

The comment does not appear on the issue until the page is refreshed
h3. Workaround

For Classic, use the old issue view.

For Next-gen, there is no workaround other than refreshing the page
fields.summary: New comment added during transition in the new issue view is not visible on the issue until page is refreshed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Dashboard widget does not work

h3. Steps to Reproduce
created a dashboard on HelloJ,
Added a Filter results widget
It asks for login and approve - took me to Ops.atlassian.com - logged in but did not change the login and approve button.
Tried to find filter to use - saved filter returned 10 results only - non of them matched the content of the box
No advanced search option.
Unable to use widget, unable to use dashboard

h3. Expected Results
Advanced search or a list of filters that match the search terms

h3. Actual Results
No results
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
No work Around 

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: <using a dashboard> <on a dashboard> <does not work>

fields.description:
If you don't have permission to edit an issue, clicking on a URL (in a URL type field) does nothing.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Create a URL type custom field;
 # Add this field to view/edit issue screens;
 # Insert a value (URL);
 # Access an issue with an account that doesn't have the 'Edit issue' permission and click on the URL.

*Expected results:*
 The URL will open in a new tab.

*Actual results:*
 Nothing happens.

*Notes:*
 You can get the same result if you add this field to the View issue screen but not to the Edit issue screen.
fields.summary: URL fields only work for users with permission to Edit issues in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing the project roles dropdown on the people page of the project, it shows empty.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and add several projects to different project roles;
# Reload the page and check the dropdown of project roles.

h3. Expected Results

The dropdown shows all project roles to filter

h3. Actual Results

The dropdown shows as blank.
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-25 at 15.52.14.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

The filter still works, only the labels are gone.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Dropdown of project roles in people menu is empty

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the "Time Since Chart" on a dashboard, the correspondent week number for a period of created issues is shifted by one day, consequently shifting the week number as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Dashboard and add the "Time Since Chart" in it;
 # However the mouse over the bar of one of the created issues and observe the value of the week;
 # Click on it and observe the JQL that appears on the Issue Navigator;

h3. Expected Results
The week number and the days for that week should be correct.

h3. Actual Results
The week number and the days on that week are incorrect.

Example:
Hovering the mouse over the column:
 !print1.png|thumbnail! 

Opening the JQL in the Issue Navigator:
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-25 at 10.40.34.png|thumbnail! 

According to https://www.epochconverter.com/weeks/2019, week number 47 should be between 2019-11-18 and 2019-11-24, and not 2019-11-17 and 2019-11-23.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: "Time Since Chart" gadget is out of sync for the weeks number

fields.description:
Story:

We would like to add more then 1 multiline field to team-managed (formerly next-gen) service desk tickets.

 

Community post:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/How-to-create-multi-line-text-field-in-next-gen-project/qaq-p/948545?tempId=eyJvaWRjX2NvbnNlbnRfbGFuZ3VhZ2VfdmVyc2lvbiI6IjEuMCIsIm9pZGNfY29uc2VudF9ncmFudGVkX2F0IjoxNTc0NjgxOTQyNTkxfQ%3D%3D]
fields.summary: Custom multi line text fields in team-managed (formerly next-gen) Servicedesk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have gadgets from add-ons, for example, the Tempo Team Timesheets gadget, it will not load the Wallboard correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard
 # Add multiple gadgets including from add-ons
 # Set up the Wallboard Slideshow and select to View as it

h3. Expected Results
The Wallboard Slideshow will load correctly.

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't load and no error is thrown.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Gadgets from Add-ons might break the Wallboard Slideshow

fields.description: At this moment override screen security only works while editing the issue or while creating the issue. It would be an essential feature if we add override screen security while transition issue from one status to another. At this moment, it works with GET and PUT only and does not work with POST.
fields.summary: Override screen security functionality for transitioning the issue from one status to another

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's not possible to clear user picker field value if using the old issue view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure there is a user picker field with a value/name already populated
 # Try to delete the name/value of the field

h3. Expected Results

The name field will clear
h3. Actual Results

It just reverts to the original person whose name was in that field.
h3. Workaround

Typing a dummy name you will see a message saying that's an invalid value/name, but if forcing the dummy name, the field will clear.

OR

Switch to the new Issue view where the field can be cleared.
fields.summary: Unable to clear user picker field value (Only in the old issue view)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When creating a filter subscription and assigning a group that does not have permissions to the filter as subscription recipients, the group members will receive an empty email when the filter subscription email is sent.

The header of the email is "[JIRA] Subscription: ${searchRequest.getName()}" and the body of the email does not specify which filter the subscription is related to.

This can cause confusion as to which filter is sending these emails and why they are empty.

 !empty_email_received.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Suggested Solution

The email could contain information about lack of permissions to the filter along with the filter name, or a warning could be displayed when assigning a recipient to a filter subscription but the recipient does not have permission to the filter.
h3. Workaround

If the filter that is sending the emails is already known, you can [share the filter|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/saving-your-search-as-a-filter-764478344.html#Savingyoursearchasafilter-sharing_filtersSharingafilter] with the group that is set as recipients of the subscription.
fields.summary: Verify filter subscription recipient permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Once you add a default reporter to an e-mail handler, that default reporter can not be removed from it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new e-mail handler (tested with "Add comment to the entire email body" and "Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue")
 # Add a Default Reporter to the handler and save it
 # Click to edit the e-mail handler and try to remove the Default Reporter by erasing the field value

h3. Expected Results

The Default Reporter should be removed
h3. Actual Results

Although you are able to erase the field and save it, the default reporter is still there after you click to save.
h3. Workaround

Delete the handler and create a new one.
fields.summary: The Default reporter can not be removed from E-mail handlers
Notify on the Jira mobile app when new issues gets created.

fields.description:
Currently we have people with multiple accounts because we merged two companies. Changing all things from one account to another and then removing the old account is not easy. We have to change assignee, reporter, commenter, etc for all issues and also change ownership of all filters, boards, dashboards, projects, etc. All of that is done manually 
and I don't even think it can all be changed. We really need a "transfer everything from this person to that person" feature at the admin level that automatically goes through every occurrence of user A and changes it to user B.
fields.summary: We need a "transfer everything from this person to that person" feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the Custom field User Picker (single user), you can be able to add a user to this field to serve for various use-cases. However due to this bug, once set, the value can't be cleared. it can only be changed to another user.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Custom field of User Picker (single user) Type
 # Add this field to the Screen
 # Create an Issue and add a user to this field
 # Try to clear the value and update the issue again.
 # refresh the page and noticed the user isn't cleared.

h3. Expected Results
 * Once you've cleared the value, the user that was there before should be cleared and the field should be blank.

h3. Actual Results
 * The Field cannot be cleared, it can only be changed to another value.
||VIDEO DEMO||
|[^fields.mov]|

*The below exception is thrown in the Dev Console:*
{noformat}
{errors: {}, errorMessages: ["The property relations_contact does not exist."],…}
errorMessages: ["The property relations_contact does not exist."]
0: "The property relations_contact does not exist."
errors: {}
httpStatusCode: {present: true}
present: true
{noformat}
{code:java}
{errorType: 0, infoMessage: "This issue does not exist in any Program or you need additional permissions to access it.", actionType: "[WBS Programs]FETCH_PROGRAMS_FOR_TASK_SUCCESS"}
actionType: "[WBS Programs]FETCH_PROGRAMS_FOR_TASK_SUCCESS"
errorType: 0
infoMessage: "This issue does not exist in any Program or you need additional permissions to access it."
__proto__: Object
{code}
h3. Workaround
||New Issue View||Old Issue View||
|Apparently on the New Issue View, on this Field, you can actually set the value to "_*None*_" as the option is present. (/)|Add 1 *<space>* character while on edit mode after clearing the user then save or update the form for it to be cleared. (/)|
fields.summary: Custom fields of User Picker (single user) value can't be removed after being set on Old Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per summary, lengthy Scriptrunner scripts are causing time out and performance issue when loading workflows.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Replicating this requires the Scriptrunner add-on.  You will need add a very long script into the post function.


h3. Expected Results
# Workflow post function page loads as per usual.


h3. Actual Results
# Very slow loading time and even time outs in more severe cases.


h3. Workaround
Currently no known workaround for this besides trimming down the Scriptrunner script. If the workflow cannot be loaded due to time out, you will have to delete and re-create the transition.
fields.summary: Lengthy Scriptrunner scripts are causing time out and performance issue when loading workflows

fields.description: The Changed clause currently does not work on Custom fields. Please provide this feature on custom fields as well for better reporting capabilities.
fields.summary: Changed clause support for Custom Fields (JIRA Cloud)

fields.description:
Jira dashboards are used for reporting purposes by many customers, but currently, it isn't possible to export dashboards to files in common format like Excel, PDF, etc.

As a Jira user, I want to be able to export dashboards into files like Excel, PDF, etc.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to be able to export dashboard report to files

fields.description: We'd like the option to be able to create a comment in a Jira task/story/etc. and simultaneously assign to a team member.
fields.summary: Add a comment and assign

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JQL "not in" not working as expected in some fields

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JQL filter such as:
{code}
project = "PROJECT NAME" AND labels not in (test)
{code}

h3. Expected Results
All tickets that do not have a label "test" should be returned.

h3. Actual Results
No tickets are returned.
 
h3. Notes
I was able to reproduce using the following fields:
* Assignee
* Labels
* Request participants

On the other hand, if we use the "in" condition it works as expected.
{noformat}
project = "PROJECT NAME" AND labels in (test)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
None available so far.
fields.summary: JQL "not in" not working as expected in some fields

fields.description:
When adding a rule to a board in a next gen project, you have an option to update a custom field (y)

When this field is of type date, the value will be the date that the action occurred, and that is also good, but I would also like an option to set this field only if it is empty..
fields.summary: More options on the "add rule" in next gen projects.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The New Issue view shows a different perspective of how Jira is moving towards the future with Agile methodology. However, when working with Multi-line Text field, having the view on the right side pane, doesn't work well with such field especially when using Field tabs.

h3. Suggestion
We would like a feature to have a Field tab for Multi-line text field which should be present on the New Issue view for issue layout  description field to group Multi-line text fields.
 !fields.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to be able to Add Multi-line Text Field in a Field Tab on the Description layout in New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The keyboard shortcuts to move the cursor position in the editor of Jira macOS app do not work as expected.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit description of an issue through the macOS app.
 # Use option + left/right keys to move the cursor.

h3. Expected Results

The cursor moves to the next character or previous as per the input.
h3. Actual Results
The cursor does not move and stays in the same position.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts do not work in the editor of Jira macOS app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The usage of brackets in a wiki markup text field is currently clashing with user mentions. It causes string truncation. This happens in the old JIRA issue view and wiki markup fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
{quote}
{noformat}
bla[]=EsAgentLo& compute_snippet_score=true&
bla[]=idCourse& bla
{noformat}

[Vincent Chin|~accountid:557057:dd697c0d-6cc7-429e-b8a1-4ccab4c19347]
{quote}

Copy the above into a wiki markup text field. 

h3. Expected Results
Should look something like this :
 !image-2019-11-20-18-20-09-793.png! 

h3. Actual Results
Comment gets truncated :

!image-2019-11-20-18-20-40-165.png! 

h3. Workaround

No workaround for now.
fields.summary: Brackets and user mentions are not working properly in wiki markup

fields.description: Currently, the user will be able to enter the worklog whenever he wants, The user should not able to enter the worklog when he exceeds the time estimate. As a user, I want to restrict the worklog when the users log more time than the estimate
fields.summary: As a user I want to restrict the worklog when the users log more time than the estimate

fields.description:
Currently, it's necessary to take many steps to create new projects selecting different templates in Jira Software.

First, you need to click to click the "Create project" button and then select "Create classic", after this it's necessary to click "Change template", switch the option from "Software" to "Business" in the select menu at the top of the screen and then the options are available. All these steps are cumbersome and not intuitive.

As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to easily select the project templates when creating new projects.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to easily select the project template when creating new projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the format [<Name>|~accountId:<Atlassian Account ID>] in the new issue, the username does not render as expected:
!Image 2019-11-19 at 7.12.13 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

The behavior and steps can be found in this video:  [^Screen Recording 2019-11-19 at 07.02 PM.mov] or by [accessing this URL|https://share.getcloudapp.com/YEuv9moZ].

h3. Expected Results

The username will render as expected:
!Image 2019-11-19 at 7.13.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

An unknown user name is displayed.

h3. Workaround

Use the following format [<Name>|~accountid:<Atlassian Account ID>].
fields.summary: When rendering the displayName the New Issue issue expects a different value than the old one.

fields.description:
Sub-tasks in the new issue view no longer wraps their summary.
In the old issue view, the Sub-task summary is wrapped and we can read the entire summary of it for longer sub-tasks.
It would be great if the sub-task summary is wrapped in the new issue view as well.

h3. Workaround

On mouse hover, the tooltip will display the entire summary.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks in the new issue view no longer wraps their summary

fields.description:
Some apps have their own Jira issue types and thus users can create them.

Some information may be persisted in custom fields while another one may be handled by the app itself. 

The idea would be to extend the  issue Create Dialog to present some panels of an app so that it can give end users the ability to define some properties/variables managed by itself that are not stored as custom fields.

An example of such app is Xray Test Management: some fields are stored as custom fields in some issues while other fields are managed internally. The user should also be able to specify the last ones in the same create dialog, by having some panels from Xray app.
fields.summary: allow customization of (issue) create dialog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Jira Cloud the the JQL field referance for *"issueLinkType"* only supports the operators *"="*, *"!="*, *"IN"*, *"NOT IN"* as covered in:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-issuelinkIssuelink

However Currently the Unsupported operators *"IS"* & *"IS NOT"* are avaliable for use in the JQL options for advanced search, and when these unsupported link type operators are used they do not supply data that would be consistent with what would be expected per the input.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud JQL Advanced Search

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# do an advanced search in an instance that has issues with and without linked issues
# use the following two JQL searches:
{code}
issueLinkType is not EMPTY
{code}
AND
{code}
issueLinkType is EMPTY
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Either the operators "IS" and "IS NOT" are not avaliable as they are noted as Unsupported operators

OR

Only issues without a linked issue will be returned when using "issueLinkType is EMPTY"  AND Only issues with linked issue will be returned when using "issueLinkType is not EMPTY"

h3. Actual Results
Each search will result in different sets of issues returned, and each result set will include both; field values *with* AND *without* a linked issues 

 
h3. Notes
The *"IS"* and "*IS NOT"* operator look to have been added to the JQL when fixing the following BUG:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72795

h3.Workaround
Option 1:
* Do not use *"IS"* or *"IS NOT"* with *"issueLinkType"* as they are unsupported operators for the field type

Option 2:
* For similar behavior to what would be expected results of an *"IS EMPTY"* or *"IS NOT EMPTY"* you can use the workaround noted in JRACLOUD-72795 and do a *filter "!="* referance to a saved filter to exclude any issue with the set list of link types, like the following:
* Create a saved filter including a list of all the current link types EXE:
{code}
saved filter = issueLinkType in ("all", "of", "the Issue Link Type Names", "as a comma separated", "List", "using Both the" "Outward Description" "And" "Inward Description")
{code}
* Then in your final JQL:
{code}
Project = EXE AND filter != <filter_ID>
{code}
fields.summary: JQL issueLinkType has Unsupported Operators is and is not

fields.description: It would be important to warn users that only the first 1000 issues on a result that has more than 1000 issues will be exported. This will prevent users from getting confused when they don't see all the expected results in the CSV file.
fields.summary: When exporting more than 1000 on the issue navigator, users should be informed that only 1000 will be exported
startOfDay() documentation in not clear about its use

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When we export Jira issues from one Cloud instance the Confluence links don't come in the exported CSV (or JSON) file and thereby are not imported to the target Cloud site.

h3. Suggested Solution
On exporting issues from Jira, Confluence links under *Mentioned On* ("Confluence page" in the new issue view) section should also get exported and on importing the CSV or JSON file to target Jira Cloud, the Confluence links should get imported. 

h3. Notes
Customer followed the second approach in this knowledge base article: [Merge multiple instances of Jira Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/merge-two-different-jira-cloud-sites-779160767.html]

h3. Workaround 
NA
fields.summary: Allow Links to Confluence pages to be exported/imported using CSV and JSON

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There are times when you will need to convert some parent issues into sub-task. Using the "Convert to subtask" button, you can be able to do such.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a classic JSD or JSW Project
 # Create some Parent Issues
 # Try to convert one of the Parent Issue as sub-task.
[Video Example|https://share.getcloudapp.com/2NulGnjN]

h3. Expected Results

On the convert selection list, you should be able to select either one of the result from the Parent search
h3. Actual Results

The dropdown selection is unclickable, and the option for Parent task can't be selected.
 !changetype.png|thumbnail!

The below exception is thrown in the Browser console:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: d.completeField is not a function
{noformat}
{code:java}
TypeError: d.completeField is not a function5 batch.js:6640:1533
    r https://d94cnjerq84bd.cloudfront.net/atl-vertigo--shard-jira-prod-us-14--2--jres.atlassian.net/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/-7f820x/b/19/70214d12d24d4c979f8bd0b27e07dc0e/_/download/contextbatch/js/atl.global,atl.general,jira.general,jira.global,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:6640
    dispatch https://d94cnjerq84bd.cloudfront.net/atl-vertigo--shard-jira-prod-us-14--2--jres.atlassian.net/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/-7f820x/b/19/0ef16ca3e0ba6fd2f9f73eadc1511767/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?locale=en-US:120
    h https://d94cnjerq84bd.cloudfront.net/atl-vertigo--shard-jira-prod-us-14--2--jres.atlassian.net/s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-CDN/-7f820x/b/19/0ef16ca3e0ba6fd2f9f73eadc1511767/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?locale=en-US:112

{code}
h3. Workaround

The known workarounds, would be:
 # To enter the issuekey as it is, however this because cumbersome, since the issuekey is entered manually.
 # Click on the "select issue" link, which should bring out a pop-up dialog screen to see other issues that has been viewed by you recently.
 !issue-selector.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Convert a Parent Task to a Subtask doesn't Allow Selection on Dropdown option

fields.description: The shortcut "Command + enter" can be used to save the field when editing a text field in JIRA, however, it is not documented in the shortcut list under the !https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/files/945101792/945101793/1/1503631799554/Screen+Shot+2017-08-25+at+1.28.10+PM.png|width=20! menu at the bottom left of the screen > *Keyboard shortcuts*.
fields.summary: Add the shortcut "Command + enter" to the shortcut list of JIRA

fields.description:
*Problem* 
When you create a new project and use shared configuration of another one, it copies schemes, yet, there's no way to copy the settings under the People page .

*Why this is important?*
If the permission scheme used is set per Project Role, this creates more manual work of adding each user and associating them with the respective project roles.

*Suggested solution*
Create a way of copying the People page's settings when creating a new project and using shared configuration
fields.summary: Ability to copy People page settings to another project

fields.description:
At this time changes made in a draft workflow such as renaming a status are applied to the production environment as well.

It would be nice if draft workflows were created in a kind of sandbox environment that would not apply to the production environment until they are published.
fields.summary: Improve workflow drafts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you remove a user from a custom user picker field with the backspace key, the removal will not be registered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

!bandicam 2019-11-18 23-05-08-233.mp4!

p/s Open in new tab is video is too hard too see.

h3. Expected Results

The user picker field changes are applied.

h3. Actual Results

The user picker field changes are not applied.

h3. Workaround

If you specify a different user with "@UserNameHere" then clear it the edit (cleared field) does get saved.
fields.summary: Custom user picker field changes are not updated under specific conditions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The documentation for custom fields doesn't state any limitations of the custom field. For example, the multi-line custom field can only display a maximum number of 32,767 characters.
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/custom-fields-types-in-classic-projects-972327807.html

h3. Suggested Solution
State the limitation of the custom fields in the documentation.
fields.summary: Update the documentation to state the limitation of custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Editing a filter gadget from the bottom of a dashboard and noticed that the panel displayed off-screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a testing dashboard with some testing gadget
 # Create a filter gadget on the bottom.
 # When trying to edit the gadget, notice that the panel displayed off-screen.

h3. Expected Results
 * Panel show correctly from the gadget

h3. Actual Results
 * The editing panel display off the screen.

h3. Workaround
 * Drag it to the top and edit it for now.
fields.summary: Editing a filter gadget from the bottom and noticed the panel displayed off-screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Create sub-task doesn't seem to work on a Business Project, while on New Issue view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Business Project > Board view
 # Select a Parent task issue
 # Try to create a subtask, given that the Description field is required. (The condition to this is that the Description field must be required from the field configuration)
 (!) This behaviour can be inconsistent, sometimes it's reproducible and sometimes it's not.

h3. Expected Results

Sub-task should be created
h3. Actual Results

Sub-task cannot be created, as the create button doesn't work.

The below exception is thrown in the Dev Console log file:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: this.createIssueFormFactory is not a function
    at t.value (jira-frontend-prod-eu-2.eu-central-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/async-issue-view.e081d4863129e56da155.7.js:1)
    at onSubmitClicked (jira-frontend-prod-eu-2.eu-central-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/async-issue-view.e081d4863129e56da155.7.js:1)
    at commons.14f05bafc967ec2721e5.7.js:1
    at Object.<anonymous> (vendor.f8c553de5e3a0fe80a64.7.js:1)
    at j (vendor.f8c553de5e3a0fe80a64.7.js:1)
    at vendor.f8c553de5e3a0fe80a64.7.js:1
    at S (vendor.f8c553de5e3a0fe80a64.7.js:1)
    at E (vendor.f8c553de5e3a0fe80a64.7.js:1)
    at T (vendor.f8c553de5e3a0fe80a64.7.js:1)
    at C (vendor.f8c553de5e3a0fe80a64.7.js:1)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Click on the Create button (+), then cancel the form, go back to the Issue while on board view and click create sub-task and see that you can now actually create it.
{quote}OR
{quote}
 * Remove the *Required* Condition from the Description field (from the field configuration) and make another custom field added to screen required.
fields.summary: Create Sub-task doesn't work on Business Project on New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

From a webhook request on my api,  sprint data  is coming in serialized  form as “customfield_10020”:[“com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.Sprint@178c78de[id=3,rapidViewId=2,state=ACTIVE,name=TP Sprint 1,goal=,startDate=2019-10-28T11:54:10.656Z,endDate=2019-11-11T11:54:08.000Z,completeDate=<null>,sequence=3]“],

while all other data in the json is deserialized
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a webhook url
 # add an issue issue inside a sprint
 # JSON data in POST request will have com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.Sprint

h3. Expected Results

{"id":3,"rapidViewId":2,"state":"ACTIVE","name":"TP Sprint 1","goal":"","startDate":"2019-10-28T11:54:10.656Z","endDate":"2019-11-11T11:54:08.000Z","completeDat":null,"sequence":3}
h3. Actual Results

[“com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.Sprint@178c78de[id=3,rapidViewId=2,state=ACTIVE,name=TP Sprint 1,goal=,startDate=2019-10-28T11:54:10.656Z,endDate=2019-11-11T11:54:08.000Z,completeDate=<null>,sequence=3]“]
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

 

Also, attached is the complete request data received from webhook
fields.summary: Sprint data coming as com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.Sprint object in webhook request json

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian Support Team,

 

The company I work with needs to calculate cycle time spent in any given workflow status for each epic, issue, and sub-task in our Jira Projects.  I currently use your, "Average Time in Status," gadget on a dashboard for metrics however, the average can very easily be altered by an outlier that cannot currently be filtered out.

For any given epic, issue, and sub-task, we need to be able to *see* (perhaps in a custom field) and *export*:
 # The date the epic/issue/subtask is moved into the status, "In Progress," (or any status for that matter).
 # The date the epic/issue/subtask is resolved or closed.

*These features do not necessarily need to be in a gadget but I do need the ability to view and export the above information*.

 

 

Please contact Katrina Lieber for specific case usage at 970-407-6259 or  [katrina.lieber@aei.com|mailto:katrina.lieber@aei.comn]
fields.summary: Average Time In Status - Cycle Time Calculations
